org.apache.orc.impl

Class OutStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • org.apache.orc.impl.PositionedOutputStream
        • org.apache.orc.impl.OutStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class OutStream
extends PositionedOutputStream
    The output stream for writing to ORC files. It handles both compression and encryption.

        public void changeIv(Consumer<byte[]> modifier)
        Change the current Initialization Vector (IV) for the encryption.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        modifier - a function to modify the IV in place

      • assertBufferSizeValid

        public static void assertBufferSizeValid(int bufferSize)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Throws exception if the bufferSize argument equals or exceeds 2^(3*8 - 1). See writeHeader(ByteBuffer, int, int, boolean). The bufferSize needs to be expressible in 3 bytes, and uses the least significant byte to indicate original/compressed bytes.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - The ORC compression buffer size being checked.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If bufferSize value exceeds threshold.
